intro: Parishella, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a genus of flowering plants in the Solanaceae family. These plants are typically shrubs or subshrubs, characterized by their hairy, silver-gray foliage. They are native to southern Africa and are known for their small, often star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. Parishella species are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Some species are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
